raw_comment:
I noticed that young women tend to reach out to a parent once a day or a few times each week compared to young men as well as, the preferred method is texting rather than something more personal like calling or seeing each other in person.
I wonder if or how this changes in the future. Do they stop reaching out? Will they start reaching out or communicating with each other more intimately like visiting in person or calling? How does their relationship with their parents affect their response?
This relates to me and my community because everyone is constantly growing up and has some kind of parental figure, and is developing into their own person and this can change the ways you interact with each other and your parents.
"Contacting the Other- Communicating With Your Parent"
ace_sentences: Young women tend to contact a parent once a day or a few times each week.
Young men tend to contact a parent less often than young women.
Texting is the preferred method of contacting a parent.
Calling is a more personal method than texting.
Visiting in person is a more personal method than texting.
I wonder if this pattern will change in the future.
I wonder if young women will stop contacting a parent.
I wonder if young men will start contacting a parent more often.
I wonder if young people will communicate with a parent more intimately in the future.
Calling is an intimate way to communicate with a parent.
Visiting in person is an intimate way to communicate with a parent.
A young person has a relationship with a parent.
I wonder how the relationship with a parent affects the response of the young person.
This topic relates to me.
This topic relates to my community.
Everyone grows up.
Everyone has a parental figure.
Everyone develops into an own person.
Growing up can change the ways that people interact with each other.
Growing up can change the ways that people interact with their parents.
The title is: Contacting the Other- Communicating With Your Parent.
